text: Giovanni Antonio d'Amato the younger (il giovane) (c. 1535–1598) was an Italian painter of the Renaissance period, active mainly in his natal city of Naples. Born to the brother of painter Giovanni Antonio d'Amato il vecchio; he married the painter Mariangiola Criscuolo. Upon his uncle's death, he entered the studio of Giovanni Bernardo Lama, also his uncle's pupil. He had two daughters and one son. ==References== * Category:1530s births Category:1598 deaths Category:16th-century Neapolitan people Category:16th-century Italian painters Category:Italian male painters Category:Neapolitan painters Category:Italian Mannerist painters
